गरी   मुलुकको आर्थिक विकासको निमित्त सर्वसाधारणको   निक्षेप र कर्जाको संरक्षण

लागि निक्षेप र सम्बर्द्धन गर्नको तथा कर्जा सुरक्षण कोषको संरक्षण
नेपालको संविधानको धारा २९६ को उपधारा (१ बमोजिमको व्यवस्थापिका संसदले यो
निक्षेप यस   ऐनको तथा   कर्जा   सुरक्षण संक्षिप्त कोष   ऐन, र प्ररम्भ :  १
परिभाषा : विषय वा प्रसङ्गले अर्को अर्थ नलागेमा यस ऐनमा,-
सुरक्षण  भन्नाले   कुनै बैङ्क वित्तीय वित्तीय पनि संस्था कर्जा
मध्यस्थताको कार्य गर्ने संस्थाले प्रदान गरेको कर्जा सुरक्षण सम्बन्धी कार्य
सम्झनु पर्छ र सो शब्दले पशुधन सुरक्षण समेतलाई जनाउंछ
कोष भन्नाले दफा ३ बमोजिम स्थापना भएको निक्षेप तथा कर्जा सुरक्षण
ग्राह्य निक्षेप भन्नाले यस ऐनले तोकेका प्राकृतिक व्यक्तिको सबै प्रकारका
पक्ष   निक्षेप खाता  भन्नाले बैङ्क तथा वित्तीय संस्थामा   निक्षेप तेश्रो
आफै तेश्रो पक्षले उसको लाभग्राही भएकोे कानूनी व्यक्ति वहेक
प्रतिनिधिको दस्तखतमा सञ्चालन गरेको खाता सम्झनु पर्छ
तोकिएको वा तोकिए बमोजिम" भन्नाले यस ऐन अन्तर्गत बनेको नियम
विनियममा तोकिएको वा तोकिए बमोजिम सम्झनु पर्छ
एनेक्षेप भन्नले बङ्क व वित्तीय संस्थाको चल्ती मुद्दती बचत व खतम
रकमलाई सम्झनु पर्छ र सो शब्दले नेपाल राष्ट्र बैङ्कले
समयमा तोकेका विभिन्न वित्तीय उपकरण मार्फत बैङ्क वा वित्तीय संस्थाले
स्वीकार गर्ने अन्य रकम समेतलाई जनाउंछ
बैङ्कबाट नेपाल इजाजतप्राप्त   बैङ्क वित्तीय निक्षेप खाता भन्नाले
संस्थामा रहेको चल्ती, बचत वा सम्झनु पर्छ मुद्दती
जुनसुकै   मुद्रामा प्राकृतिक व्यक्तिको निक्षेप निक्षेप रकम भन्नले
वा वित्तीय तथा वित्तीय संस्था सम्बन्धी   प्रचिलत
कानून बमोजिम इजाजत प्राप्त वाणिज्य बैङ्क वा वित्तीय संस्था सम्झनु पर्छ
मन्त्रालय भन्नाले नेपाल सरकार, अर्थ मन्त्रालय सम्झनु पर्छ
मूल्याङ्कन   मिति भन्नाले ऐनमा   तोकिए बमोजिम गरिएको
रकमको शोधभर्ना   गरिनु वार्षिक   सुरक्षण बपतको रकम

summary: The text discusses the establishment and operation of the Nikshep and Karja Surakshya Kosh under the Nikshep tatha Karja Surakshya Kosh Act, 2073. It aims to enhance the credibility of the banking and financial system for the economic development of the country. The Act defines terms related to deposits and loans, outlines the roles of the governing body, and specifies the procedures for security and protection of funds. It also emphasizes the legal framework for the operation of the fund and the responsibilities of the members and institutions involved.

summary: The text discusses the rules and regulations related to investment security in Nepal, as outlined in the Investment Security Regulations of 2075. The government has the authority to enforce these rules under the Investment and Debt Security Act of 2073. The regulations cover various aspects such as membership fees, annual security fees, and calculation methods for security fees. Additionally, it outlines the responsibilities of banks and financial institutions in managing investment security.

summary: The text discusses the regulations related to the protection and management of deposits and loans in Nepal, as outlined in the Deposit Protection Regulation, 2075. It covers the calculation and collection of annual security fees by financial institutions, as well as the procedures for providing information to members regarding security fees. The regulations also specify the requirements for maintaining records and submitting reports to the authorities.

summary: The text discusses various amendments made to the Nepali Civil Service Regulations from 2050 to 2076. The regulations cover different aspects of civil service administration, including definitions, authorities, and procedures for implementing the regulations. The amendments have been introduced over the years to ensure effective governance and accountability within the civil service sector. The regulations also outline the process for conducting management audits and reporting to the relevant government authorities.

summary: The text discusses the regulations of the Civil Service Welfare Fund, 2072, published in the Nepal Gazette. It highlights the rights granted by the Civil Service Act, 2049, and the establishment of the fund. The regulations define key terms like "Chairperson," "Employee," and "Institution." It outlines the procedures for fund management, including the allocation of funds for various purposes such as employee benefits, pensions, and international travel expenses. The regulations also specify the roles and responsibilities of the fund management committee.
